content:
• Friday, July 22, 2011
  • CAT

    While some are on edge about a slowdown in China's growth, Caterpillar (CAT -5.8%) CEO Doug...

    While some are on edge about a slowdown in China's growth, Caterpillar (CAT -5.8%) CEO Doug Oberhelman is comfortable with a small decline that keeps the Chinese economy on even footing. Of course, given Caterpillar's disappointing earnings and concerns about U.S. growth, it might need all the demand from China it can get.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • GLP

    Petroleum products distributor Global Partners (NYSE:GLP) fell 6.7% after preannouncing a Q2 net...

    Petroleum products distributor Global Partners (NYSE:GLP) fell 6.7% after preannouncing a Q2 net loss of "no more than $2 million," compared with a consensus forecast for a $0.10/share profit. The company also announced an amendment to its $1.25B bank credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • GLF

    Oil & gas services firm Gulfmark Offshore (NYSEMKT:GLF) is up 9.8% after reporting Q2...

    Oil & gas services firm Gulfmark Offshore (NYSEMKT:GLF) is up 9.8% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $96.9M (+4.5% Y/Y) and $0.51, blowing away the $90.6M and $0.32 consensus. CEO Bruce Streeter says the results "confirm our belief in an improving market for our vessels over the near term."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • UTEK

    Ultratech (UTEK +7.1%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at D.A. Davidson following...

    Ultratech (UTEK +7.1%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at D.A. Davidson following better-than-expected Q2 results from the laser processing equipment maker. Davidson says UTEK's new product offerings and balanced exposure to both front-end and back-end customers should enable it to continue to outperform the market over the next few years.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • FLEX

    Flextronics (FLEX +10%) rallies after reporting FQ1 earnings jumped 12% on a double-digit...

    Flextronics (FLEX +10%) rallies after reporting FQ1 earnings jumped 12% on a double-digit increase in sales, as the company posts strong growth across all core units. Needham reiterates a buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • GSK

    Human Genome Sciences (HGSI -7.5%) tumbles after an earnings miss, but Leerink Swann's Joseph...

    Human Genome Sciences (HGSI -7.5%) tumbles after an earnings miss, but Leerink Swann's Joseph Schwartz says the sell-off is overdone. "We think the numbers going forward are very achievable and would use weakness as buying opportunity," the analyst says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • MCD

    McDonald's (MCD +2.8%) hit a 52-week high this morning, as it finds success in passing on rising...

    McDonald's (MCD +2.8%) hit a 52-week high this morning, as it finds success in passing on rising food costs to its customers while same-store customer orders rose 3.8% Y/Y for the first half of 2011. Janney Capital raises its 2011 EPS estimate by $0.10 to $5.23, and says MCD should gain market share, driving share prices still higher. (earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • RRR-OLD

    RSC Holdings (RRR-OLD +14%) jumps after its Q2 beat estimates across-the-board, posting a 46%...

    RSC Holdings (RRR-OLD +14%) jumps after its Q2 beat estimates across-the-board, posting a 46% Y/Y earnings increase on solid top-line sales growth.  Rental revenue rose at least 17% for the third-straight quarter, with similar gains expected for the next quarter as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC +8.5%) is trading higher after posting Q2 revenues that were better...

    Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC +8.5%) is trading higher after posting Q2 revenues that were better than estimates, as gross margins increased sequentially and operating expense declined.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • FRAN

    Womens apparel chain Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) jumps +49% on it's first day of trading,...

    Womens apparel chain Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) jumps +49% on it's first day of trading, capping another banner week for the IPO market.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • MOH

    Molina Healthcare (MOH -7.6%) takes a hit as Q2 earnings were a bigger miss than originally...

    Molina Healthcare (MOH -7.6%) takes a hit as Q2 earnings were a bigger miss than originally thought. After reviewing the company's financials, analysts discovered a few items noted in it's earnings release that boosted earnings, but only amount to one-time gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +16.1%) and SanDisk (SNDK +9.9%) top S&P movers after each...

    Advanced Micro Devices (AMD +16.1%) and SanDisk (SNDK +9.9%) top S&P movers after each report strong quarters (I, II). Other chip stocks (SOXX +2.5%) also are jumping, partly in anticipation that the group’s pricing challenges might be starting to ease: MU +6.4%, KLAC +2.9%, MCHP +2.5%, TER +2.5%. Among big chippers, INTC +1.6%, AMAT +1.7%, TXN +0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • GDI

    Shares of Gardner Denver (GDI +6.7%) soar after posting strong Q2 results and raising estimates...

    Shares of Gardner Denver (GDI +6.7%) soar after posting strong Q2 results and raising estimates after the close yesterday. The company sees backlogs at record levels and strong growth in emerging markets helping lift FY11 EPS to $5.20-$5.30 vs $4.86 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • EZPW

    Pawnshop chain Ezcorp (EZPW -8%) trades lower after narrowly missing estimates despite a 33%...

    Pawnshop chain Ezcorp (EZPW -8%) trades lower after narrowly missing estimates despite a 33% jump in FQ3 profits. Bottom-line results were impacted by a larger-than-expected increase in bad loan debt and increased competitive pressures in Texas.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • WDC

    Sandisk (SNDK) is now up 9.9% after reporting Q2 EPS that easily beat estimates. While the...

    Sandisk (SNDK) is now up 9.9% after reporting Q2 EPS that easily beat estimates. While the company's 2011 revenue guidance fell short of consensus, it was effectively an increase from Sandisk's prior guidance, and doused fears of plummeting NAND flash memory demand. Micron (NASDAQ:MU) is up 5.7% in sympathy. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • TVTY

    Healthways (HWAY -11%) is down after Q2 EPS fell a penny short of expectations. Revenues beat...

    Healthways (HWAY -11%) is down after Q2 EPS fell a penny short of expectations. Revenues beat estimates, but overall earnings are significantly less than 2010. For the quarter, EPS is down 40% Y/Y, with revenues decreasing 4% over the same period.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +3.6%) gets a boost after HTC (HTCC.PK) says it will create a dedicated button on its...

    Sina (SINA +3.6%) gets a boost after HTC (HTCC.PK) says it will create a dedicated button on its new smartphones in China to allow owners to connect to Sina's microblogging service and share music and photos.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • ACO

    Amcol International (ACO -12.6%) is trading lower after Q2 results missed consensus, as gross...

    Amcol International (ACO -12.6%) is trading lower after Q2 results missed consensus, as gross margins deteriorated in each of the specialty mineral product maker's three major business segments. Fluctuations in foreign exchange rates boosted sales, but profits were hit by higher fuel and labor costs and reduced demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • VISN

    Some volume is lifting VisionChina Media (VISN +13.3%), another company directing advertising to...

    Some volume is lifting VisionChina Media (VISN +13.3%), another company directing advertising to mass transport systems in China. The company gave a board seat to Kit Leong Low, CFO of Focus Media Holding (FMCN +2.6%). (Previously on CCME)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • SFG

    StanCorp Financial (SFG -14%) is taking a hit after its Q2 falls far short of analysts'...

    StanCorp Financial (SFG -14%) is taking a hit after its Q2 falls far short of analysts' expectations. Earnings for the quarter dropped 40%, driven by higher claims in the company's insurance services segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • QRVO

    Shares of Triquent Semiconductor (TQNT +8.6%) and RF Micro Devices (RFMD +5.2%) jump higher,...

    Shares of Triquent Semiconductor (TQNT +8.6%) and RF Micro Devices (RFMD +5.2%) jump higher, easily outpacing the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOXX +1.4%), following rival Skyworks' (SWKS +17.8%) strong FQ3 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • ATSG

    Air Transport Services Group (ATSG -17%) drops after its second-largest customer, DB Schenker,...

    Air Transport Services Group (ATSG -17%) drops after its second-largest customer, DB Schenker, says it's phasing out the dedicated air-cargo network supported by ATSG's airline subsidiaries, Air Transport International, and Capital Cargo International Airlines.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • AVID

    JPMorgan piles on to Avid Technology's (AVID -24%) bad quarter, cutting the stock to neutral....

    JPMorgan piles on to Avid Technology's (AVID -24%) bad quarter, cutting the stock to neutral. "The new Avid still faces many of the same challenges as the old Avid," JPMorgan says, "including the complexity of marketing multiple product lines in numerous geographies."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • RVBD

    Having fallen 13% in the prior two days due to weak results from Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) and F5...

    Having fallen 13% in the prior two days due to weak results from Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) and F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV), Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) is up 5.8% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $79.7M (+49% Y/Y) and $0.29, ahead of a consensus of $76.9M and $0.27. The company is also slightly raising its FY2011 revenue and EPS forecasts. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • GENE

    Genetic Technologies (GENE -24%) resumes trading after being halted since July 12. The company...

    Genetic Technologies (GENE -24%) resumes trading after being halted since July 12. The company had requested the halt after its stock rose 45% over three trading sessions just prior to a proposed capital raising.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • AVID

    Avid Technology (NASDAQ:AVID) is down 23.7% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $161.3M (-1%...

    Avid Technology (NASDAQ:AVID) is down 23.7% after reporting Q2 revenue and EPS of $161.3M (-1% Y/Y) and -$0.10, below a consensus of $170.4M and $0.09. Though some felt the company would gain from Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) recent missteps, it's apparently not enough to offset Avid's long-term decline relative to Apple and Adobe's (NASDAQ:ADBE) cheaper video editing solutions. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • CLS

    Celestica (CLS +9%) trades higher after posting a strong Q2, easily beating estimates. The...

    Celestica (CLS +9%) trades higher after posting a strong Q2, easily beating estimates. The company says it's experiencing "robust margin expansion" and healthy top-line growth as new contracts obtained in late 2010 come on line.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • ENTG

    Shares of Entegris (ENTG +7.5%) pop, helped along by an upgrade from Dougherty to Buy from...

    Shares of Entegris (ENTG +7.5%) pop, helped along by an upgrade from Dougherty to Buy from Neutral. Yesterday the firm's CEO said in a CC advanced semiconductor products will be added to the pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM

  • Traders fear Brazil's sugar cane crop could fall below estimates, helping send sugar prices...

    Traders fear Brazil's sugar cane crop could fall below estimates, helping send sugar prices +3.4% higher. The output estimate has been slashed by Brazil's sugarcane industry association to 32.4M tonnes from 34.6M tonnes, although some traders see it falling as low as 31M tonnes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • PGI

    Premier Global Services (PGI +17%) misses Q2 estimates on the bottom-line due to expenses, but...

    Premier Global Services (PGI +17%) misses Q2 estimates on the bottom-line due to expenses, but posts a solid increase in revenues as its sales pipeline continues to grow. The company raises its FY11 outlook and announces a 5M share buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • AMD

    Upgrades are pouring in for AMD (+12%) after the company's Q2 results and Q3 guidance pleased a...

    Upgrades are pouring in for AMD (+12%) after the company's Q2 results and Q3 guidance pleased a market expecting the worst given weak PC demand and Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) Sandy Bridge ramp. Canaccord expects AMD to gain notebook and server share in the second half, and also thinks average selling prices could rise.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD +16%) jumps after reporting a solid Q2. Revenue easily topped estimates on strong...

    Cepheid (CPHD +16%) jumps after reporting a solid Q2. Revenue easily topped estimates on strong growth in its clinical segment and international sales. Baird analyst Quintin Lai comments in a note the company's results "continue to impress."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • BCR

    Shares of C. R. Bard (BCR -9.4%) sink after reporting sub-par Q2 results last night led by a...

    Shares of C. R. Bard (BCR -9.4%) sink after reporting sub-par Q2 results last night led by a $181M charge the firm realized related to a legal settlement involving faulty hernia repair products.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • ATHN

    Athenahealth (ATHN +20.2%) soars as Q2 profit quadruples on a growing client base, and the...

    Athenahealth (ATHN +20.2%) soars as Q2 profit quadruples on a growing client base, and the company announces the acquisition of Proxsys, another cloud- based data-management firm in the health-care space, for $36M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • KLIC

    Jefferies raises Kulicke & Soffa (KLIC +5%) to a buy, saying the company has established a...

    Jefferies raises Kulicke & Soffa (KLIC +5%) to a buy, saying the company has established a solid lead on rivals in transitioning over to copper for long-life tool solutions for gold ball bonding.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • BX

    Citi adds Blackstone (NYSE:BX) to its Top Pick Live list and sets a $22 price target for shares....

    Citi adds Blackstone (NYSE:BX) to its Top Pick Live list and sets a $22 price target for shares. Yesterday the firm reported a whopping 243% Y/Y increase in Q2 net income. Shares +1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • FLIR

    More on FLIR Systems (NASDAQ:FLIR): Q2 misses across-the-board as earnings were impacted by...

    More on FLIR Systems (NASDAQ:FLIR): Q2 misses across-the-board as earnings were impacted by litigation settlement and related expenses, as well as from delays in government procurement. The company lowers its outlook for the remainder of FY11. Shares -3.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • MCD

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) Q2: Revenue beats consensus by $270M; 8% Y/Y growth excluding...

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) Q2: Revenue beats consensus by $270M; 8% Y/Y growth excluding currency benefits, up from 7% in Q1. Global comparable sales up 5.6% Y/Y, up from 4.2% in Q1. 6% operating income growth in U.S.; 24% in Europe; 34% in Asia/Pacific, Middle East, and Africa. Shares +2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • CBI

    More on Chicago Bridge & Iron (NYSE:CBI): Q2 profit jumps 31% on $1.2B in new awards, and...

    More on Chicago Bridge & Iron (NYSE:CBI): Q2 profit jumps 31% on $1.2B in new awards, and double-digit growth on the company's top line driven by transportation and storage projects in Russia and Canada. JPMorgan raises its price target on the stock from $50 to $52.50. Shares +5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • MAXR

    Benchmark upgrades DigitalGlobe (DGI) to a Buy based on based on "valuation and potential upside...

    Benchmark upgrades DigitalGlobe (DGI) to a Buy based on based on "valuation and potential upside in 2H," and sets a $32 price target. Shares +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • AMD

    Shares of Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) spike higher after the firm issues positive...

    Shares of Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) spike higher after the firm issues positive guidance after the bell yesterday. Shares now +9.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • RT

    Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT) shows signs that its turnaround may be faltering, as profits for FQ4 and...

    Ruby Tuesday (NYSE:RT) shows signs that its turnaround may be faltering, as profits for FQ4 and its full-year outlook both fell short of expectations. Earnings fell 16% despite strong revenue growth as higher costs and interest expense hurt the bottom line. Shares -9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT): Q2 adj. EPS of $1.72 misses by $0.06; EPS $1.52. Revenue of $14.23B...

    Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT): Q2 adj. EPS of $1.72 misses by $0.06; EPS $1.52. Revenue of $14.23B (+37% Y/Y). Shares -4.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • WDC

    BMC reiterates a Buy rating on Western Digital (NYSE:WDC), and keeps a price target of $48. The...

    BMC reiterates a Buy rating on Western Digital (NYSE:WDC), and keeps a price target of $48. The firm beat estimates for FQ4 last night on sharply lower net income, and says demand from equipment manufacturers is stronger-than-expected. Shares +3.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM
  • HON

    Honeywell (NYSE:HON): Q2 EPS of $1 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $9.1B (+15% Y/Y). Sees FY'11 EPS...

    Honeywell (NYSE:HON): Q2 EPS of $1 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $9.1B (+15% Y/Y). Sees FY'11 EPS at $3.85-4.00. Shares -2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM
  • VOD

    Vodafone (VOD +1.6%) issues upside Q1 revenue guidance of £11.659B vs. consensus of...

    Vodafone (VOD +1.6%) issues upside Q1 revenue guidance of £11.659B vs. consensus of £11.54B. Q1 trading was "consistent with management's expectations, with a resilient performance in northern Europe and good momentum in our emerging markets. The Group therefore confirms its guidance for the current financial year." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 AM
  • GE

    More on GE's (GE +1%) earnings: "With our fifth-consecutive quarter of double-digit earnings...

    More on GE's (GE +1%) earnings: "With our fifth-consecutive quarter of double-digit earnings growth, we continue to execute in a volatile environment... GE's backlog grew to a record high of $189B. Total infrastructure orders were up 24%, reflecting robust strength in equipment orders, up 33%, and service orders up 16%." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 AM
  • GE

    GE (NYSE:GE): FQ2 operating EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $35.6B beats by $0.9B....

    GE (NYSE:GE): FQ2 operating EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $35.6B beats by $0.9B. Shares +1%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 AM
